alert.note: Alert for Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 12:09PM CDT until May 09 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL BAYFIELD...IRON...SOUTHERN ASHLAND AND NORTH CENTRAL SAWYER COUNTIES... At 1209 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Clam Lake, or 21 miles northeast of Chippewa Flowage East, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Mellen, Gurney, Upson, Saxon, Hurley and Gile. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
